p.s: Chris is in this scene presented as a popular student by greeting many people.
The director used a minimal frog perspective and placed Chris in the centre to show that he is the most important character in this moment.
When Chris noticed Starr a crane movement was used to show at who or what Chris looks at.
A medium close up is used to see his upper body but also the background when going towards Starr but also when he is dancing.

In the given scene several stylistic devices were used to bring up dramatic effects: A sad and calm music to show Chris' feelings up to Starr when he is walking in the hallway and when Starr describes him to show his personality.
The director also built in a moving camera on Chris' path.
The lights are not in a warm and cozy way to show the audience the relationship between Starr and Chris is.
Although Starr is still shocked of the incident with Khalil who was a friend of her and got shot by the police she acts normal when with Chris.
All in all Chris is presented as one of the most important characters and without knowing that Starr was with Khalil when he died.
Chris' behaviour is compared to Starr's family normal and not in a sad way.
